## Functions

### Functions to obtain a list of Wikidata entities

WDQS_SearchByLabel_Exact(string, langs='en', instanceof="", Pproperty="")

WDQS_SearchByLabel_Startswith(string, lang='en', langsorder='en', instanceof="", Pproperty="")

WDQS_SearchByLabel_Inlabel(string, langsorder='en', lang="", instanceof="", Pproperty="")

WDQS_OccupationCount(Qoc)    # Qoc = the Wikidata entity for an occupation

WDQS_OccupationEntities(Qoc, nlimit=10000)

WDQS_OccupationEntitiesWikipedias(Qoc, nlimit=5000)

### Function to obtain information from a list of Wikidata entities or a single one.

WDQS_isInstanceOf(entity_list, instanceof)

WDQS_Wikipedias(entity_list, wikilangs="", instanceof="", nlimit=1500)

WDQS_isValid(entity_list, nlimit=50000)

WDQS_Property(entity_list, Pproperty, langsorder='en', nlimit=10000)

WDQS_IdentifiersOfAuthority(Pauthority, langsorder='en', instanceof="")

Pauthority = Authority Database Property in Wikidata

WDQS_EntityInfo(entity, langsorder='en', wikilangs="")

WDQS_EntityInfo_tiny(entity, langsorder='en', wikilangs="")

WDQS_FilmInfo(film_entity, langsorder='en', wikilangs='')

### Functions to obtain information using the WikiMedia API's

MW_Opensearch(string, project='en.wikipedia.org', profile="engine_autoselect", redirects="resolve")

MW_WikidataEntity(titles, project='en.wikipedia.org', redirects=TRUE)

MW_Redirects(titles, project="en.wikipedia.org")

MW_PagePrimaryImage(titles, project="en.wikipedia.org")

MW_PageFiles(titles, project="en.wikipedia.org", exclude_ext='svg|webp|xcf')

MW_Pageviews(article, start, end, project="en.wikipedia.org", access="all-access",
             agent="user", granularity="monthly", redirects=FALSE))

MW_XtoolsInfo(article, infotype="articleinfo", project="en.wikipedia.org", redirects=FALSE)

MW_XtoolsInfoAll(article, project="en.wikipedia.org", redirects=FALSE)

### Functions to obtain information (viafID or cluster records) using the VIAF API

VIAF_AutoSuggest(author) : obtains viafID

VIAF_Search(CQL_Query) : obtains clusters records

#### The following functions are wrappers to the previous one:

VIAF_Search_anyField(string) : CQL_Query = cql.any = "string"'

VIAF_Search_allmainHeadingEl(name) : CQL_Query = 'local.mainHeadingEl all "name"

VIAF_Search_allNames(name) : CQL_Query = 'local.names all "name"'

VIAF_Search_allPersonalNames(name) : CQL_Query = 'local.personalNames all "name"'

VIAF_Search_allTitle(title) : CQL_Query = 'local.title all "title"'

### Function to retrieve a cluster record using the viafID.

VIAF_GetRecord(viafid,  record_format='viaf.json'): retrieve a cluster record

### Function to extract information from a VIAF cluster record

VIAF_Titles(viaf)

VIAF_Gender(viaf)

VIAF_Dates(viaf)

VIAF_Occupations(viaf)

VIAF_Sources(viaf)

Gets all sources and identifier in each one.

VIAF_SourceId(viaf, source)

Gets the identifier in that source, if exits.

VIAF_Wikipedias(viaf)



## Package installation and loading

To install and load the updated version of the netCoin package simply run the following commands:
```{r eval=FALSE}
install.packages("wikiTools")
```
```{r echo=TRUE}
library(wikiTools)
```



## Examples of Wikidata functions using WDQS

#### Search string "Iranzo" in different positions
Exact search in Label or exact search in AltLabel (case sensitive and diacritics)

Optional: limit by instanceof Wikidata class (Qxx).

Optional: return information of some properties (Pproperties, Pxxx).
```{r echo=TRUE}
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Exact(string='Iranzo', langs='es|en')
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Exact(string='Iranzo', langs='es|en', instanceof = 'Q5')
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Exact(string='Iranzo', langs='es|en', instanceof = 'Q5|Q101352')
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Exact(string='Iranzo', langs='es|en', instanceof = 'Q5', Pproperty = 'P21|P569|P570')
```

#### Search at the beginning in Label or AltLabel (diacritics and case are ignored)
```{r echo=TRUE}
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Startswith(string='Iranzo', lang='en', langsorder='es|en')
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Startswith(string='Iranzo', lang='en', langsorder='es|en', instanceof = 'Q5')
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Startswith(string='Iranzo', lang='en', langsorder='es|en', instanceof = 'Q5|Q101352')
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Startswith(string='Iranzo', lang='en', langsorder='en', instanceof = 'Q5', Pproperty = 'P21|P569|P570')
```

#### Search in any position in Label or AltLabel (diacritics and case are ignored)
If lang=='' search in any language, else the search is performed only in the language indicated.
```{r echo=TRUE}
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Inlabel(string='Iranzo', langsorder='es|en')
```
Search only in Chinese (Simplified) (language code: zh):
```{r echo=TRUE}
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Inlabel(string='Iranzo', langsorder='zh|es', lang='zh')
```
Optional instanceof and Property
```{r echo=TRUE}
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Inlabel(string='Iranzo', langsorder='es|en', instanceof = 'Q5')
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Inlabel(string='Iranzo', langsorder='es|en', instanceof = 'Q5|Q101352')
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Inlabel(string='Iranzo', langsorder='es|en', instanceof = 'Q5', Pproperty = 'P21|P569|P570')
```

#### aux: getting a vector of entities (`l`) to use later.
```{r echo=TRUE}
df <- WDQS_SearchByLabel_Inlabel(string='Iranzo', langsorder='es|en')
l <- df$entity
```

#### WDQS_isInstanceOf
Check if elements in entity_list are instance of a Wikimedia class
```{r echo=TRUE}
df <- WDQS_isInstanceOf(entity_list=l, instanceof='Q5')
# Not TRUE
df[!df$instanceof_Q5,]
```

#### WDQS_Wikipedias
Search for Wikipedia pages in all/some languages

Optional: instanceOF (limit to entities which are instance of a Wikidata class)
```{r echo=TRUE}
df <- WDQS_Wikipedias(entity_list=l)
df <- WDQS_Wikipedias(entity_list=l, wikilangs='es|en|fr')
df <- WDQS_Wikipedias(entity_list=l, wikilangs='es|en|fr', instanceof="Q5")
```

#### WDQS_Occupations
Count entities, or get the entities with that occupation, also get Wikipedia pages

Note: depending on connection speed, nlimit parameter musts be adjusted
```{r echo=TRUE}
WDQS_OccupationCount(Qoc='Q2306091')                    # Qoc for Sociologist
l  <- WDQS_OccupationEntities(Qoc='Q2306091')           # l=entities: vector
lw <- WDQS_OccupationEntitiesWikipedias(Qoc='Q2306091') # lw=dataframe
 # We can obtain the same information using previous function WDQS_Wikipedias:
 lw2 <- WDQS_Wikipedias(entity_list=l, wikilangs='')
 # Verifying:
 all(lw['Q10320558','pages'] == lw2['Q10320558','pages'])
 # Verifying:
 all(sort(strsplit(lw['Q9061', 'pages'], '|', fixed = T)[[1]]) ==
     sort(strsplit(lw2['Q9061', 'pages'], '|', fixed = T)[[1]]))
```

#### WDQS_isValid.
Check if the Wikidata entities are valid. A entity is valid if it has a label
or has a description. If one entity exists but is not valid, is possible that
it has a redirection to other entity, in that case, the redirection is
obtained. Other entities may have existed in the past, but they are currently
deleted.
```{r echo=TRUE}
l2 <- append(l, c("Q115637688", "Q105660123"))  # Note: adding two new entities
v <- WDQS_isValid(l2)
# Not valid
v[!v$valid,]
```

#### WDQS_Property
Obtain properties of entity_list.
```{r echo=TRUE}
p <- WDQS_Property(l, Pproperty = 'P21|P569|P214', langsorder = 'es|en')
```

#### WDQS_IdentifiersOfAuthority
Search for Wikidata entities that have an identifier in the Wikidata authority property "Pauthority".

Optional: instanceOf

Example: Pauthority=P4439 (has identifier in the Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía)
```{r echo=TRUE}
mncars   <- WDQS_IdentifiersOfAuthority(Pauthority="P4439", langsorder = 'es|en')  # 1286  [human, groups, etc.]
mncarsQ5 <- WDQS_IdentifiersOfAuthority(Pauthority="P4439", langsorder = 'es|en', instanceof = 'Q5')  # 1280
# Entities are not 'human' (Q5) [see entityDescription column):
mncars[!(mncars$entity %in% mncarsQ5$entity),]  # not instance of Q5.
```

#### WDQS_EntityInfo
Get some properties of a Wikidata entity.
```{r echo=TRUE}
df1 <- WDQS_EntityInfo(entity='Q134644', langsorder = 'es|en')
# Also a "tiny" version
df2 <- WDQS_EntityInfo_tiny(entity='Q134644', langsorder = 'es|en')
# Differences: fields non existing in the tiny row set as "--":
Aleixandre <- rbind(
  df1,
  data.frame(c(df2, sapply(setdiff(names(df1), names(df2)), function(x) "--")),
             row.names = 'tiny')
)
```

#### WDQS_FilmInfo
Get some properties of a Wikidata entity for a film.
```{r echo=TRUE}
BenHur    <- WDQS_FilmInfo(film_entity='Q180098', langsorder='es|en', wikilangs = 'es|fr')
Nosferatu <- WDQS_FilmInfo(film_entity='Q151895', langsorder='es|en', wikilangs = 'es|fr|en')
# Nosferatu has a public video:
Nosferatu$video
# Combining data-frames:
films <- rbind(BenHur, Nosferatu)
```


## Examples of WikiMedia functions

#### MW_Opensearch
Search articles that contains any words (note: it is better to use a large string)

Some search profiles:
```{r echo=TRUE}
df <- MW_Opensearch(string='Duque de Alba', project='es.wikipedia.org', profile="engine_autoselect", redirects="resolve")
df <- MW_Opensearch(string='Duque de Alba', project='es.wikipedia.org', profile="strict")
df <- MW_Opensearch(string='Duque de Alba', project='es.wikipedia.org', profile="fuzzy")
```

#### MW_WikidataEntity
Checks if titles are in a Wikimedia project and returns the Wikidata entity for them, if they have one.

Note that URLdecode("a%CC%8C") is the letter "a" with the combining caron (ǎ)
```{r echo=TRUE}
df <- MW_WikidataEntity(c('Max Planck', URLdecode("a%CC%8C"), 'Max', 'Cervante', 'humanist'),
                        project='en.wikipedia.org')
```

#### MW_Redirects
Obtains the redirections of a page (the page itself can be a redirect to other page).

Returns a vector for each title, in each vector the first element is the destiny, rest are all pages that redirect to it.
```{r echo=TRUE}
a <- MW_Redirects(c('Cervantes', 'Planck', 'Noexiste'), project='es.wikipedia.org')
a
```

#### MW_PagePrimaryImage
Gets the URL of de Primary image as a URL of Wikimedia pages.

#### MW_PageFiles
Gets all URL of files inserted in the pages (images, sounds, videos...), using '|' as separator, and excluding some extensions in the exclude_ext parameter.

Both functions automatically resolve redirects (the destiny is the "normalized" column of the data-frame returned).
```{r echo=TRUE}
i <- MW_PagePrimaryImage(c('Max Planck', URLdecode("a%CC%8C"), 'Max', 'Cervante', 'humanist'))

f <- MW_PageFiles(c('Max Planck', URLdecode("a%CC%8C"), 'Max', 'Cervante', 'humanist'),
                  exclude_ext = "svg|webp|xcf")
```

#### MW_Pageviews
Gets visits that a page have had in a date interval

Optional: redirects
```{r echo=TRUE}
v <-  MW_Pageviews(article="Cervantes", start="20230101", end="20230501",
                   project="es.wikipedia.org", granularity="monthly")
vv <- MW_Pageviews(article="Cervantes", start="20230101", end="20230501",
                   project="es.wikipedia.org", granularity="monthly",
                   redirects=TRUE)
```

#### MW_XtoolsInfo
Obtains information (as vector) about an article in the Wikimedia project.

Infotype: articleinfo, prose, links

Optional: redirects
```{r echo=TRUE}
x <-  MW_XtoolsInfo(article="Cervantes", infotype="articleinfo", project="es.wikipedia.org")
xx <- MW_XtoolsInfo(article="Cervantes", infotype="articleinfo", project="es.wikipedia.org",
                   redirects=TRUE)

y <-  MW_XtoolsInfo(article="Miguel de Cervantes", infotype="links", project="es.wikipedia.org")
yy <- MW_XtoolsInfo(article="Cervantes", infotype="links", project="es.wikipedia.org",
                    redirects=TRUE)
```

#### MW_XtoolsInfoAll
Gets all information (articleinfo, prose, links).
```{r echo=TRUE}
z  <- MW_XtoolsInfoAll(article="Miguel de Cervantes", project="es.wikipedia.org")
zz <- MW_XtoolsInfoAll(article="Cervantes", project="es.wikipedia.org",
                       redirects=TRUE)
```

## Examples using VIAF functions

#### VIAF_AutoSuggest
Searches authors. Sometimes the same author appears several times, under a different name).

Return a data-frame.

Important: The API returns a maximum of 10 records.
```{r echo=TRUE}
VIAF_AutoSuggest('Iranzo')
VIAF_AutoSuggest('Esparza, María')
VIAF_AutoSuggest('Escobar, Modesto')
# Note that four rows are returned, but only two different viafids.
```

#### VIAF_Search
Search using CQL_Query

See https://www.oclc.org/developer/api/oclc-apis/viaf/authority-cluster.en.html

```{r echo=TRUE}
# Auxiliary function that extracts specific information from each record.
showVIAF <- function(r) {
  i <- 0
  for (j in r) {
    i <- i+1
    # Get viaf record
    viaf <- j$record$recordData
    viafid <- viaf$viafID
    cat(paste0("-----------\nRecord #",i,"\nSources:\n"))
    print(VIAF_Sources(viaf))
    cat("Gender: ");       print(VIAF_Gender(viaf))
    cat("Dates: ") ;       print(VIAF_Dates(viaf))
    cat('Occupations: ');  print(VIAF_Occupations(viaf))
    cat("Titles: ");       print(VIAF_Titles(viaf))
    cat("Wikipedias: ");   print(VIAF_Wikipedias(viaf))
  }
}
```

Search in any field (cql.any)

Operator is "=": so search all terms and only those ones:
```{r echo=TRUE}
CQL_Query <- 'cql.any = "García Iranzo, Juan"'
r <- VIAF_Search(CQL_Query)
# r contains complete VIAF records (sometimes seen as a "cluster record",
# which is unified by combining records from many libraries around the world)
showVIAF(r)
```

Wrapper
```{r echo=TRUE}
r <- VIAF_Search_anyField("García Iranzo, Juan")
showVIAF(r)
```

Search in 1xx, 4xx, 5xx fields of MARC record (local.names)

Operator is "all": search all terms
```{r echo=TRUE}
CQL_Query <- 'local.names all "Figuerola"'
r <- VIAF_Search(CQL_Query)
```

Wrapper
```{r echo=TRUE}
r2 <- VIAF_Search_allNames("Figuerola")
cat(length(r), length(r2))
```

Records found exceeds the maximum per request API limit : 250
```{r echo=TRUE}
CQL_Query <- 'local.names all "Bolero"'
r <- VIAF_Search(CQL_Query)
```

Search in 100, 400, 500 fields of MARC record (local.personalNames)

Operator is "all": search all terms
```{r echo=TRUE}
CQL_Query <- 'local.personalNames all "Modesto Escobar"'
r <- VIAF_Search(CQL_Query)
showVIAF(r)
```

VIAF_Search_allmainHeadingEl: 1xx fields of MARC record:
```{r echo=TRUE}
r <- VIAF_Search_allmainHeadingEl("Escobar Mercado, Modesto")
```

Search in Titles
```{r echo=TRUE}
CQL_Query <- 'local.title all "Los pronósticos electorales con encuestas"'
r <- VIAF_Search(CQL_Query)
showVIAF(r)
```
